bibl.title: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Guy Charles Moore Godfrey, July 24, 1900

div1.p: Stark reprimands Godfrey for his course of action in the face of an epidemic of yellow fever. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Guy Charles Moore Godfrey, July 24, 1900
div1.opener:
L.S. 208, MilitarybFile, 1900.
Chief Surgeon's Office,
HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF THE PROV. OF HAVANA AND PINAR DEL RIO,
Quemados, Cuba, July 24th, 1900.
Capt. Guy C.M. Godfrey, Asst. Surgeon, U.S.A.,
Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba.
(Thro'Military Channels)
Sir:-
div1.p:
Being temporarily in charge of the Chief Surgeon's
Office, I shall simply reprimand you for the course you have pursued in
the face of an epidemic of yellow fever.
REMEMBER MY WARNING TELEGRAM OF SOME TIME PAST.

Our strained personal relations prohibit any further remark
from this office.

Major Walter Reed, Surgeon U.S.A., has written the
Surgeon General a full report of your conduct of affairs and you will
doubtless hear from him at length.

For the present you will remain at Pinar del Rio Barracks
holding yourself in readiness to comply with instructions that will be
forwarded in due course of time.
div1.closer:
A. N. Stark. Captain & Asst. Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Acting Chief Surgeon.
